level.title: Piping and Redirection
level.description: Master using pipes and redirections to combine commands powerfully

exercises.title: Pipe Output
exercises.description: Use pipe (|) to send output from 'ls' to 'grep' to find files containing 'data'.
hints: The pipe | sends output to next command

exercises.title: Chain Multiple Pipes
exercises.description: Use multiple pipes: 'cat log.txt | grep error | wc -l' to count errors.

files.name: log.txt
files.content:
error: failed
error: timeout
warning: check
error: critical

hints: You can pipe as many commands as needed
Type: cat log.txt | grep error | wc -l

exercises.title: Redirect to File
exercises.description: Use '>' to redirect output of 'ls' to a file called 'filelist.txt'.

exercises.title: Redirect Error Output
exercises.description: Use '2>' to redirect error messages to 'errors.log'.
hints: 1> is for output, 2> is for errors

exercises.title: Pipe to Multiple Outputs
exercises.description: Use 'tee' to save output to file AND display it: 'ls | tee filelist.txt'.
hints: tee saves to file and shows output
Useful when you want both file and display
